document.title: CTE Model Curriculum Standards: Business and Finance

0A082447291346DDBB79D3FB8B82029C.description: Analyze special challenges in operations and strategic management in international business.

1F524C6D59EB47ECA2AF0A5968DE4898.description: Contrast the four forms of international operations: working through a foreign intermediary, licensing agreement with the foreign business, forming a strategic alliance, or becoming a multinational corporation.

CAD3E675074D4E5980E97C4224860FE6.description: Compare how products are prepared for international versus domestic distribution.

A270D8CDBE05405EB43D852B1D2BA5DF.description: Distinguish between direct and indirect distribution channels.

3AA22A1F21B745B5959878A7AA1D796F.description: Determine the effect of imports and exports on production and manufacturing.

CE3F1B4245BC46DCB592A11481FB5D60.description: Explain how private, nonprofit, and government agencies assist in global trade.

986EA02D22F44D45A202F15142783656.description: Reconstruct the logistics of importing and exporting products and services.

501F4B0C476642B9A5F6B8337B0A99E7.description: Determine exposure of doing business internationally and develop a recommendation for entering the international market.

76CEFD9C887E41D79A04FC4944046757.description: Analyze choices available to international businesses for protection against risk and financial loss.

930D34BB980842E4A374ACDEC3A7CA36.description: Set inventory levels based upon location of customers, durability of products, and logistics.

74C08221DEDE42199DA256FCE58B752F.description: Determine pricing for products and services traded internationally.

D1EDE4F3E3A046BDBD2F1DF7175C98BD.description: Calculate the effects of exchange rate fluctuation.

69A74A1D478345AB890D488CE48E89C4.description: Assess the risks associated with various methods of entering the global marketplace.

58A8327724D248678F554C3B4FEE30D2.description: Develop strategies to adapt and respond to meeting the differences in culture, market, habits, experience, and laws.

74DD8D81FF294910A720DC8973A7C27B.description: Identify factors that determine balance of trade and research balance of trade for a developed nation, a developing nation, and an undeveloped nation.

95CAF61D7F2040E0BC5C460222652E0B.description: Research measures used to evaluate the economic conditions of a country.

CEAB512B39B44D4D884E2125DA12CB46.description: Differentiate between the types of market structures and their effect on the price and the quality of goods and services produced.

82BBF270EA2C479D931E8071513597FE.description: Apply marketing concepts to international business situations.

72560B38EDC14C8DB0757B876A71B6D3.description: Analyze security measures used to protect businesses and consumers engaging in international e-commerce.

9E80DA6480E3453EA2D5CD70DD46C94B.description: Integrate appropriate use of the Internet in business.

4D13E0DF7DF34395AADA074CB5AEA8F0.description: Identify hardware and software commonly used in international business operations.

94C58FE4B820483A95AF966B83951397.description: Recognize the role of information and communications technology in modern global trade.

A14F8FED41CE4BBAA1DB5A0BDC24DC4D.description: Produce documentation for international trade, including letters of credit, import/export documents, permits, taxes, and duties.

10386675B64E4F0F98768680B7B35744.description: Assess the ways in which financial markets influence interest rates, inflation, balance of trade, and unemployment and the impact on business decisions.

14D13B360E8140ADB004D84AEABFE7AC.description: Compare the variety of ways in which funds are transferred in foreign trade.

B9FE718084E2454BAAA0DD082E3ECF95.description: Analyze factors that affect currency and exchange rates.

2CD53CC0D3B848E6A316CD232FDC526D.description: Explain the concepts, role, and importance of international finance and risk management.

B90EB44AC7F34E4BA623E189186D137B.description: Describe common financing sources and the payment methods used for international business transactions.

981D1A97DBC44BFAB4D4EA51DDE14341.description: Analyze the role of government in economic systems.

0AA7A5DA766E4F61B9FE16A5CC428CF9.description: Examine the ways in which a country's natural, financial, and human resources influence international business.

9EE8D75CCD2A4E0D90CACED24F882C2A.description: Relate the balance of trade concepts to the import/export process.

F59D593FDF4246D7964B1659075D3A9A.description: Examine the role of trade, trade agreements, protectionism, and monetary markets in the global economy.

9634B52E00474A67938A7C74216544AF.description: Explain the importance of productivity and analyze how specialization, division of labor, investment in physical and human capital, and technological change affect productivity and global trade.

9A283DD418B1413192268760C0877E82.description: Describe the laws of absolute and comparative advantage.

69BC622C6B124248BF2839E851A672E4.description: Apply economic concepts as they relate to international business.

2F43DECF1A3A461AB15C1B1EDDFB6A93.description: Analyze special challenges in human resources and strategic management in international business.

989B56A4C574402C99F680EDAD28C705.description: Apply communications strategies necessary and appropriate for effective and profitable international businesses relations.

5CD3208A68784F7890848B4FB0B02C81.description: Illustrate how geographic conditions affect trade.

672EC753F87C4B24802328C2A6E2666E.description: Interpret the effect of culture, customs, and politics on trade.

039827A7F3AF477980B5F81C91702436.description: Describe the interrelatedness of geographic, social, cultural, political, and legal factors and how they shape the global business environment.

EF2456173B21457A86AC66A5E4297DDD.description: Construct and defend a business plan for a product or service traded internationally.

7BD5AA8CFB7C4165A75C84436640C464.description: Analyze how domestic and international competition in a market economy affects goods and services produced and the quality, quantity, and price of those products.

BB9BD973C53541298C882247F8B6D68C.description: Illustrate the process of buying, selling, and promoting products in a modern global trade.

D27BD306BDD847E495F91C755C7AE1A0.description: Conduct market research for a product or service traded internationally.

ACCA258CEA3642948BD75A5F76D7302F.description: Identify forms of business ownership and entrepreneurial opportunities available in international business.

2FA80590891F4992A7A2018A221E2CDC.description: Describe the fundamental concepts of international business.

comments: The relative ease of travel and the use of electronic communication have seemingly diminished the size of the globe, yet the interdependence of countries for goods and services causes this marketplace to grow, thrive, and become increasingly more competitive. Students focusing on the occupational area of international trade develop an understanding of the global business environment and the interconnectedness of cultural, political, legal, historical, economic, and ethical systems.

CEF05CB4477E46EB8271C616B483BF9E.description: Determine client needs and wants and develop and present a written investment recommendation to the client using standard writing conventions.

253DC8906D164B158DB4BE2C8D1650E9.description: Examine the environments in which securities and investments services are offered, including securities sales agents, securities and investment firms, and securities markets.

176C3FE2E49F422E8FDB220CCD988765.description: Discuss legal and ethical considerations in providing financial advice, buying or selling securities, insurance or real estate, and borrowing or lending money.

23A0B75A16B34CF9A3DAECA8B8AFE09E.description: Demonstrate techniques for managing human resources to maximize operational efficiencies and effectiveness.

E19E3692767A4A74AC25E4386ABA6D8D.description: Demonstrate characteristics of professionalism in working relationships with customers and employees.

6814676A98EC41798F410A8BF7274AE0.description: Identify licensure requirements for various professionals in the financial services industry.

E95BB71F56D14D1DA03301B20FC7C9CB.description: Evaluate financial services providers and explore the duties and activities of financial service careers.

27BC1E4334B8488B86AC88959974ADBF.description: Describe the role of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and the Financial Industry Regulation Authority (FINRA) and explain regulation of the industry, including legal and ethical considerations in all aspects of financial services.

2775615A261A4001B8FE5AFCAE049E8A.description: Select sources to finance venture creation/start-up.

4AA20A67080644529A6FE13F8F0A7A82.description: Consult federal resources and independent rating companies for reports and research on investment vehicles and providers.

D4253F923C89488EA49A6A15F02C6F6D.description: Describe factors that affect the value of an asset, including industry trends, price to earnings ratio, cash flow, growth rate, timing, inflation, interest rate, opportunity cost, risk, and required return.

0583AEF3CFA042BDAD4B7F16D0AAF459.description: Describe reasons why investors buy and sell and the methods they use.

14B1CB3BC5714EB18673CE071DC25597.description: Recognize the categories and characteristics of major investment vehicles, such as stocks, bonds, real estate, mutual funds, venture capital, retirement investment plans, and education savings plans.

F015DC5B4CCF4D10B8670EF11781A97B.description: Describe the functions, responsibilities, and ethical considerations of a financial institution.

3E9EB3B4A46D4468A69D28A644F78FA4.description: Explain the time value of money.

2F4A88552AEA4294B4E4D5CBF384C0D8.description: Evaluate the variety, nature, and diversity of investment vehicles and the elements that contribute to financial growth and success.

FC8FB602A1554939A2C9CB026100AB11.description: Identify main operations and evaluate services provided by financial institutions.

551884DEB447494FB6B6044E044E98AA.description: Analyze choices available to consumers for protection against risk and financial loss.

13BA03A476234D26AB85FF83D0D6E105.description: Compare and contrast risk management methods of avoidance, reduction, assumption, and shifting.

29F8E34CBF37483BAAC3B5AAF5373389.description: Explain the importance of actuarial science in the insurance industry.

6175393E856142FF95DCD45E74B9168D.description: Formulate an insurance and risk management plan.

628E0CE084E9496EA6933A1A79EBDAD0.description: Analyze factors that affect currency and exchange rates.

ABCD461EB7F14CE9859A6AD573139440.description: Compare the variety of ways in which funds are transferred in foreign trade.

F4CDAF64E6AB45C5B98021B543987004.description: Explain the concepts, role, and importance of international finance and risk management.

F195844C82784EB593730FFCA00C3444.description: Explain the role of investment banking in the primary marketplace.

FE9A6050E67A4A35BFF6821DB0D8EC00.description: Assess the ways in which financial markets influence interest rates, inflation, balance of trade, and unemployment and the impact on business decisions.

34F98FD8897E4DB3B2196ABBFE69ABA0.description: Illustrate the business cycle elaborating on leading, coinciding, and lagging economic indicators.

EEAC3D1360C148D9B93F220588F70DE4.description: Identify causes of stock price fluctuations and the relationship between bond prices and yields.

825C8F33CA1E4BAEAE09C9D4B65B9F3D.description: Define capital and explain how it is used to create wealth.

740D515A23634AD7A470EBC840E5D073.description: Apply economic concepts as they relate to financial services.

03D240E6E3614C0AAEE6C78C5BC4F481.description: Calculate the impact of various taxes on financial decisions.

EB09D3A664294A3DB8C76B009D39DAFC.description: Compare state and federal regulatory compliance of financial institutions and related services.

2629A42E859446F3B16E9BFCB37C384A.description: Explain the role of the Federal Reserve System, Internal Revenue Service (IRS), and Consumer Protection Laws.

B5BB408D866F42FEA6BEA82F1C8FE170.description: Evaluate the impact of federal, state, and local regulations on financial management decisions.

21A4A425AEAD4D2CB96A18C0C2CEC68A.description: Develop a working knowledge of individual income tax procedures and requirements to comply with tax laws and regulations.

8452AA049C2243D6BD4D5454490EDA83.description: Analyze an annual report and financial statement to predict profitability.

DA7643E2AE2E44E28D7CE99A1EBDC073.description: Interpret financial ratios and other metrics, such as cash flow and breakeven analysis, concentration risk, return on investment, leveraged debt, market share, and opportunity costs.

59B809DD9EEB48B783F5201266CBC76C.description: Apply differential analysis and present value concepts to make decisions.

D3D600557C574A5D8173BAA3433E9681.description: Interpret financial data, analyze results, and make sound business decisions to promote a financially healthy business.

753C622355354EBB8D5544F8728995A8.description: Identify strategies financial institutions utilize to make decisions about profitability, such as savings and lending ratios.

AD4EFB49628F443191740B5031AFFC2F.description: Use equations, graphical representations, and other accounting tools to classify, record, and summarize financial data.

C16F9F441B9C4F4BAF602C7F3A782367.description: Identify strategies and systems in real-world situations to maintain, monitor, control, and plan the use of financial resources.

C73247D947724C6A9D977D5ABF2F9D5D.description: Identify key ratios and banking calculations such as interest and annual percentage rate.

EFEB6F8AF25D479F97C9F0B785F3C60B.description: Interpret financial formulas commonly found in financial institutions to aid in the growth and stability of financial services.

F043F28A69A744EF8629565A451AF7A9.description: Develop a working knowledge of individual income tax procedures and compliance with tax laws and regulations.

6C7C0CF24F0F42F88CE9553DDE695576.description: Discuss International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) and the convergence between IFRS and GAAP.

7692980BA6D1469A84BC2D93D217CA90.description: Discuss state and federal regulation of the accounting industry.

0367519015DC4289A43EE188ABA791D2.description: Use planning and control principles to evaluate the performance of an organization.

03C6F297CD66416A9095497C06D82418.description: Complete the steps in the accounting cycle in order to prepare financial statements and communicate how accounting procedures affect financial statements.

72B16CA0B9A14A4290716101619816EE.description: Describe the two methods of accounting (cash and accrual) and the different accounting concepts (financial, tax, cost, nonprofit and auditing) used to report a business' financial position as it pertains to sole proprietorships, corporations, and partnerships.

F44A39EC951440978382DAC9A56D5F45.description: Explain how the application of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) impacts the recording of transactions and the preparation of financial statements.

5CDA49F0068B4830812477C19E24EFC1.description: Devise a plan to protect against identity theft.

7A13C5D9FC3443739C38768E22AF7A46.description: Develop tax planning strategies for financial planning.

98DB97DB68164866A7A5C4B4275B6FAF.description: Develop and defend a spending/savings plan.

EF440E24F3934683A540CE1A428D8CD0.description: Analyze factors that affect the choice, cost, and legal aspects of using credit.

0644C4CA26E04917887CD804C329F1D1.description: Apply a decision making model to maximize consumer satisfaction when buying consumer goods and service.

071A4D9084D746118F8904D1574E3C5A.description: Evaluate the opportunity costs of savings and investment options to meet short and long term goals.

742986CF904B43DF81208126BD1B3CD7.description: Identify various forms of income and analyze factors that affect income as part of the career decision making process.

8EB2C7FFC166401D934D469E3665D474.description: Create and use budgets to guide financial decision making.

comments: Financial services are an essential aspect of every business institution and organization. Students in this pathway investigate the field of financial management, including how it is impacted by industry standards as well as economic, financial, technological, international, social, legal, and ethical factors. Students formulate and interpret financial information for use in financial management decision making, such as compliance and risk management. This pathway may include programs of study for accounting, banking, securities and investments, and other financial specializations.

121897EFA482406EB07CCC9B3D6687F6.description: Change variables in a master plan for resources, analyze its effect, and recommend corrective actions.

52F56C7CD22E499DA96B89DD99B6C5C0.description: Create a master plan for resources that addresses market demand, sales, and operations planning.

4046EF7C374B4A88879DE5C3070D03A2.description: Summarize materials management, including effective inventory management practices, E= Procurement, and continuous control practices.

04F171C6A21A4214A21E4764A26557AA.description: Illustrate the management of the complete flow of materials and activities in the supply chain from suppliers to customers.

9509B361A8C541449BA6030F7867E7E0.description: Apply principles of supply chain management and SCM 2.0 to a business model.

0ED2F41353C5485CA06CC585D6BC519D.description: Practice selling techniques used to aid customers and clients in making buying decisions.

CB6DB094A3C745FD86DFE9CE45D5FD5F.description: Differentiate the components of a promotional plan (e.g., advertising, public relations, and sales promotion) and describe how the plan is used to achieve a stated outcome.

2C9288C635F14567B90E5E6272DC52FB.description: Interpret how market research is used to develop strategies for marketing.

978DBDBFA8A548579A4CBA2215C47835.description: Conduct market analysis and assess the business organization's position within their industry.

45514EAD22694D1495E313AFC2EC865D.description: Explore how products and services are conceived, developed, maintained, and improved in response to market opportunities.

78BB3CD4F89E48DF92D32BF2BAE21E5D.description: Investigate data security systems for business.

9D430C2CA8A148859E906110314F3BE8.description: Integrate appropriate use of the Internet in business.

0A336FFA4BEA4C278B549A73B149393E.description: Examine technological trends and analyze the impact of technological innovations on the marketing and distribution of goods and services.

57FE8C85811C4A3FBE7C04B6A95D5E73.description: Apply appropriate software used in business.

3131851CAB8E4879A90F93583C49534D.description: Describe appropriate computer hardware used in business.

3A22462F7FB94FC39DFF3F17D1AD3520.description: Utilize information and technology tools to conduct business effectively and efficiently.

2DFFB4B08A0E4185BCC28DDC90B19D7B.description: Compare and contrast the various types of taxes in terms of the business structure.

466E8FAAAD6B414D87F304E328880C18.description: Describe the concept and process of risk management, including the use of risk management tools such as insurance.

9C2596FBE6484F85801D57F71572E01B.description: Explain the importance of risk management and regulatory compliance in business.

2033E8C2139842CFA4D4EDFB7000BA65.description: Create and use budgets to guide financial decision making.

83138D89602C43C6B5C913E075C9403D.description: Assess how types of financial markets influence interest rates, inflation, balance of trade, and unemployment and the impact on business decisions.

CAC0DBEA38744F1BB6F34019B95308F4.description: Analyze how credit reports quantify credit worthiness.

6276AF77A26E4500BB61B87A3C91D308.description: Compare and interpret financial reports for internal and external use to analyze risk and return to make business decisions.

D11947E64D614BA190797A9D0519CA9D.description: Determine investment and finance options available at different stages of a business or product life cycle.

5D873226049C492CA07BB182928AABB7.description: Describe factors that affect the value of an asset, inflation, interest rates, risk, and return.

B1F33BD02C8D416FAFBD7D54C92B6189.description: Analyze financial data in order to make short-term and long-term decisions.

802A07E5BF104381B97AF29E46FAD254.description: Show the relationship between economic conditions and financial markets, including exchange rates.

388194DC8C4C4EF4BFF58C4BA29A7B38.description: Illustrate the business cycle elaborating on leading, coinciding, and lagging economic indicators.

0023C5FFD6A14EB99D580B426E939638.description: Calculate productivity with various levels of input.

45147B77972A4754A679FC990E4590FA.description: Recognize the determinants of supply and demand and their impact on pricing.

6BE0AAD1A8954F39AFA6975BC95127D0.description: Explain the role of business in a free-enterprise system.

5C0FDD8D17124C72B448FE2B8729FC62.description: Identify factors of production needed to create wealth.

76465DBA994D4502915A9B49F46AA66E.description: Apply economic concepts as they relate to business.

4C20F9E8E50646BEAED17C6FA3E084AC.description: Apply operations management principles and procedures to the design of an operations plan.

B826C44BDB2F4A0987B79064C6849624.description: Describe the role of organized labor and its influence on government and businesses.

7CE2BDCEEC444AE580E2009480FAE480.description: Summarize techniques for managing human resources to maximize operational efficiencies and effectiveness.

643BCF07C78549FB9ACB876BE7AF7304.description: Recognize a business' responsibility to employees, shareholders, society, and the environment.

4E8E7E99CBF74529806A5BB85BF9B69E.description: Describe management's role in demonstrating leadership, motivating employees, resolving conflict, addressing stress, and recognizing formal and informal employee groups.

C5C58FC208BF4F5EB84894EBC29B409E.description: Explain the organizational structure of various business environments.

31482113DB38457883279141D38AE884.description: Investigate the functions and techniques of management and organizational structure and distinguish between small and large companies.

131E640EF0DB4679B1E3EDD0399EA24A.description: Evaluate beneficial change, or added value, of a specific project.

503D85C60F6545E383B1B2184BD8A7FB.description: Optimize allocation of resources necessary to achieve predefined objectives.

58FDF59F16A442688C66B47116632AC3.description: Develop a project schedule, including the constraints of cost, time, and scope, to illustrate project structure using Gantt, Program Evaluation Review Technique (PERT), or other project planning tools.

89B6F540F52440FDB8E413E35C2BF83D.description: Determine Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Realistic and Time-bound (SMART) goals for a specific project.

6A101A4393254F81B76721DDF539B940.description: Plan, organize, secure, and manage resources of a project to achieve specific goals.

34B88C6F738C45349035B198E47730FD.description: Construct and defend a business plan (components may include an executive summary, organizational structure, market analysis, Strengths Weaknesses Opportunities and Threats (SWOT) analysis, marketing plan, operating procedures, financial data, and feasibility and supporting documentation).

22E163CF2C304E71B69AA0F60A6516AB.description: Determine the type of business organization most appropriate for various business profiles.

02D51E32E10441249267D4419BE9D78D.description: Develop personal management skills to function effectively, efficiently, and collaboratively in a business environment.

356D4B1981E243D48A5DED63733A0374.description: Analyze management theories and their application within the business environment.

F25B352DC1D9423185A87C74B6323A55.description: Recognize personal traits and leadership styles of entrepreneurs and business leaders.

F7CA3197A5A24CEBA1601F61731A969D.description: Explain entrepreneurship and the fundamentals of developing a new business.

comments: Management consists of planning, leading, and controlling an organization or effort to accomplish a goal. In the Business Management pathway, students learn entrepreneurship and business fundamentals, goal-setting, resource allocation, organizational structure and management techniques, economics, financial data, risk management, information technology, and supply chain management.

AD41E9460B3A4CAF9EBECDCC9901A37E.description: Create a portfolio, or similar collection of work, that offers evidence through assessment and evaluation of skills and knowledge competency as contained in the anchor standards, pathway standards, and performance indicators.

096BA86C7C394306BA4A8ABFEC8B416F.description: Employ entrepreneurial practices and behaviors appropriate to Business and Finance sector opportunities.

957227E4E4C742D3A46D173BCDF1D507.description: Demonstrate entrepreneurship skills and knowledge of self-employment options and innovative ventures.

40DA1FB05F6A48FCAC86A10501CAB803.description: Demonstrate proficiency in a career technical pathway that leads to certification, licensure, and/or continued learning at the postsecondary level.

877F26902E9640D496EB782CB22F674F.description: Utilize work-based/workplace learning experiences to demonstrate and expand upon knowledge and skills gained during classroom instruction and laboratory practices specific to the Business and Finance sector program of study.

comments: Demonstrate and apply the knowledge and skills contained in the Business and Finance anchor standards, pathway standards, and performance indicators in classroom, laboratory, and workplace settings, and through the Future Business Leaders of America (FBLA) career technical student organization.

D5E4593470AE4413B293BA8B235150A3.description: Develop a system for keeping and using financial records and a personal financial plan to manage cash flow and maintain creditworthiness.

28E29BAB257543D9A84563537EB151DF.description: Recognize the importance of marketing in a global economy.

B1FE247028974DFFA6D1E551D9266CCE.description: Apply the economic principles and concepts fundamental to business operations.

0F8202D852B8471C8AA487D4E3A11F3B.description: Evaluate the impact of local, state, federal, and/or international regulations on business and financial management decisions.

C761A6C1D8EC4FE4BE7EF48BB029E8EF.description: Integrate the techniques and strategies used to foster positive, ongoing relationships with customers, suppliers, investors, and community.

8EF1BCA9514C43E493A0093669DB72AC.description: Adapt the distribution concepts and processes needed to move, store, locate, and transfer ownership of goods or services.

FB091232FB69474CA0C64D9C811C74DA.description: Evaluate the variety, nature, and diversity of investment vehicles and the elements that contribute to financial growth and success.

9920A6CA0BA94B66A4D59028EB9ADA32.description: Interpret financial data, analyze results, and make sensible business decisions to promote a financially reliable business.

50DB61FCE88543A694B46BD2BE8C5ECE.description: Collaborate with industry experts for specific technical knowledge and skills.

D7DB9EBD60E94C1E8CAC1C956BB9DFD2.description: Construct projects and products specific to the Business and Finance sector requirements and expectations.

BEBB103A6B694C238BAC8CC7C6A7BAE3.description: Comply with the rules, regulations, and expectations of all aspects of the Business and Finance sector.

89A6D337E29A4AC3B48A8A9A95C3D244.description: Interpret and explain terminology and practices specific to the Business and Finance sector.

comments: Apply essential technical knowledge and skills common to all pathways in the Business and Finance sector, following procedures when carrying out experiments or performing technical tasks.

A613A3ABED864B1090020ECC8A2CECF7.description: Participate in interactive teamwork to solve real Business and Finance sector issues and problems.

0B54974376ED423AAEEA2CE77831B5B3.description: Respect individual and cultural differences and recognize the importance of diversity in the workplace.

B0BCBCA35B674467B48648F42354F23D.description: Understand that the modern world is an international community and requires an expanded global view.

4B8CC6ABA1DD4E3AA46308B931FD732B.description: Explain how professional associations and organizations and associated leadership development and competitive career development activities enhance academic preparation, promote career choices, and contribute to employment opportunities.

403E36FED2EB487782D0E384D0EE7A58.description: Understand the characteristics and benefits of teamwork, leadership, and citizenship in the school, community, and workplace setting.

75269D6B530D44A3801B3AA5B3E3BD0C.description: Identify the characteristics of successful teams, including leadership, cooperation, collaboration, and effective decision-making skills as applied in groups, teams, and career technical student organization activities.

DEC67282EA014B5E9697A0311951E482.description: Define leadership and identify the responsibilities, competencies, and behaviors of successful leaders.

0E7EA092833244C3BC3BD55A5ED23111.description: Work with peers to promote divergent and creative perspectives, effective leadership, group dynamics, team and individual decision making, benefits of workforce diversity, and conflict resolution as practiced in the Future Business Leaders of America (FBLA) career technical student organization.

EFF6D3DE05BE4D24A5909E00B0331975.description: Conform to rules and regulations regarding sharing of confidential information, as determined by Business and Finance sector laws and practices.

9769166A2AFE47DDB880F849AB5BF637.description: Adhere to copyright and intellectual property laws and regulations, and use and appropriately cite proprietary information.

A01FFE1C82AE412487B248E175FAD05F.description: Analyze organizational culture and practices within the workplace environment.

1C0FD6A9BBE044E6BD00A7FB4E47A838.description: Explain the importance of personal integrity, confidentiality, and ethical behavior in the workplace.

B11021186EE14EDA87BFC5D913E7B67C.description: Demonstrate ethical and legal practices consistent with Business and Finance sector workplace standards.

EB6D439614734E2A9F5B8798834AEB0A.description: Identify local, district, state, and federal regulatory agencies, entities, laws, and regulations related to the Business and Finance industry sector

DC5145E15A714491BFE609A116F32FEB.description: Access, analyze, and implement quality assurance standards of practice.

comments: Practice professional, ethical, and legal behavior, responding thoughtfully to diverse perspectives and resolving contradictions when possible, consistent with applicable laws, regulations, and organizational norms.

4645020308B24E9C8AADD96024CDEAA9.description: Explore issues of global significance and document the impact on the Business and Finance sector.

42790E86F8C14AFCAD418FB0D3EECC91.description: Demonstrate the qualities and behaviors that constitute a positive and professional work demeanor, including appropriate attire for the profession.

18047A2858CE4A5B8213A6EA1DE550C0.description: Demonstrate knowledge and practice of responsible financial management.

BF38511EB06C4C24BEBFC11DD42536F7.description: Apply high-quality techniques to product or presentation design and development.

B9865C99AA1540BBA2E1E96260648A78.description: Practice time management and efficiency to fulfill responsibilities.

4ABA0DD70C8544FEB8BC7D3646BD6359.description: Understand the need to adapt to changing and varied roles and responsibilities.

E9CCDCD618A34A9A894F3D4D42571902.description: Explain the importance of accountability and responsibility in fulfilling personal, community, and workplace roles.

E5D5889B396C434980C3BA029F63D6FC.description: Recognize how financial management impacts the economy, workforce, and community.

comments: Initiate, and participate in, a range of collaborations demonstrating behaviors that reflect personal and professional responsibility, flexibility, and respect in the Business and Finance sector workplace environment and community settings.

363BF6F3DE2B4A92AC7F79D50602ED04.description: Be informed of laws/acts pertaining to the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA).

210D84737BCC416ABBC0F90E699B69E7.description: Maintain a safe and healthful working environment.

A27A853B007442E98E989009940DFA8B.description: Demonstrate how to prevent and respond to work-related accidents or injuries; this includes demonstrating an understanding of ergonomics.

4AAD5DDE1AAD4FF7AB86B16BD41DB209.description: Practice personal safety when lifting, bending, or moving equipment and supplies.

25BF7B7F09D74529AE2C2BFA5CC2D0DE.description: Use health and safety practices for storing, cleaning, and maintaining tools, equipment, and supplies.

7B1A7988E5344142AA1E2E2CBA8D432E.description: Interpret policies, procedures, and regulations for the workplace environment, including employer and employee responsibilities.

7D8D732D156542B7A6675B140471FD10.description: Locate, and adhere to, Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) instructions.

comments: Demonstrate health and safety procedures, regulations, and personal health practices and determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and domain-specific words and phrases as related to the Business and Finance sector workplace environment.

8DB169ACB81C4880BCDE0A084DA7A371.description: Interpret information and draw conclusions, based on the best analysis, to make informed decisions.

059291380C0F4D15B3BEB8701D0507D5.description: Use systems thinking to analyze how various components interact with each other to produce outcomes in a complex work environment.

58B0FE28008C4FC4BCED88E5F079B50C.description: Solve predictable and unpredictable work-related problems using various types of reasoning (inductive, deductive) as appropriate.

8FB2B50BA140411F94E0D70F0B70DF62.description: Identify and ask significant questions that clarify various points of view to solve problems.

comments: Conduct short, as well as more sustained, research to create alternative solutions to answer a question or solve a problem unique to the Business and Finance sector using critical and creative thinking, logical reasoning, analysis, inquiry, and problem-solving techniques.

1313CF061D0248518C8926D87110A72B.description: Assess the value of various information and communication technologies to interact with constituent populations as part of a search of the current literature or in relation to the information task.

15DC6E38882F44D39B2D2F69C53C8BFF.description: Research past, present, and projected technological advances as they impact a particular pathway.

5EE695A4B86C45C69A0EE1EDB988ED1B.description: Discern the quality and value of information collected using digital technologies, and recognize bias and intent of the associated sources.

E2AD9918141B4DB8822829280D738D34.description: Use information and communication technologies to synthesize, summarize, compare, and contrast information from multiple sources.

26D12177BDF2422A9BCDB3073131608B.description: Employ Web-based communications responsibly and effectively to explore complex systems and issues.

0FBD9B5008D84FB8AD256311D1B3D79C.description: Use electronic reference materials to gather information and produce products and services.

comments: Use existing and emerging technology to investigate, research, and produce products and services, including new information, as required in the Business and Finance sector workplace environment.

B5F0D12445184F3BBEC14B05C5494E53.description: Develop a career plan that reflects career interests, pathways, and postsecondary options.

76F2DF64B4D540BCB3C38DF5554D9171.description: Understand how digital media are used by potential employers and postsecondary agencies to evaluate candidates.

B3217C0A3650469BACA46DD30ADBBFBA.description: Recognize the importance and impact small businesses have on our state, nation and world economies.

AC8AC8914BFB486D8086013FC9B17B0E.description: Recognize the role and function of professional organizations, industry associations, and organized labor in a productive society.

F7ACDD8332B74C05832C2CE707E63534.description: Integrate changing employment trends, societal needs, and economic conditions into career planning.

9497FD33B6934F8CBDF6FE909BC27D4A.description: Research the scope of career opportunities available and the requirements for education, training, certification, and licensure.

ED22F4A3403B4855A6AC83728658C40E.description: Explore how information and communication technologies are used in career planning and decision making.

7741A5823843431A80BC2285066384CC.description: Evaluate personal character traits such as trust, respect, and responsibility and understand the impact they can have on career success.

ED887FF295594B938587DBCE6CC7D51F.description: Identify personal interests, aptitudes, information, and skills necessary for informed career decision making.

comments: Integrate multiple sources of career information from diverse formats to make informed career decisions, solve problems, and manage personal career plans.

9A64C4BADF9F4749AA7EDC45D675C46E.description: Advocate and practice safe, legal, and responsible use of digital media information and communications technologies.

A7279FB25BD4429E95DF77824C8E4F44.description: Communicate information and ideas effectively to multiple audiences using a variety of media and formats.

9E2B53213A5A449183039111E5872B05.description: Demonstrate elements of written and electronic communication such as accurate spelling, grammar, and format.

A1AD7AB37816405AA9F3FEE1A54E7C16.description: Interpret verbal and nonverbal communications and respond appropriately.

A84A850EB4CF47E984AEE36AF801EEEB.description: Identify barriers to accurate and appropriate communication.

53949319D1534275895020224C535C9A.description: Recognize the elements of communication using a senderreceiver model.

comments: Acquire and accurately use Business and Finance sector terminology and protocols at the career and college readiness level for communicating effectively in oral, written, and multimedia formats.

Analyze and apply appropriate academic standards required for successful industry sector pathway completion leading to postsecondary education and employment. Refer to the Business and Finance academic alignment matrix for identification of standards.
